trans-unit.source: Provides data for the <xref href="System.Web.UI.Design.IControlDesignerView.ViewEvent"></xref> event.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.IControlDesignerView.ViewEvent> event is raised by the designer host for certain actions on a control on the design surface.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.IControlDesignerView.ViewEvent> is handled by a <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ViewEventHandler> delegate method, which takes a <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ViewEventArgs> object as a parameter.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ControlDesigner> class supplies a default delegate to handle the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.IControlDesignerView.ViewEvent>.

Custom control designers override the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ControlDesigner.OnClick%2A>, <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ControlDesigner.OnPaint%2A>, and <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.TemplatedControlDesigner.OnTemplateModeChanged%2A> methods to process those events for the control on the design surface.

The designer host initializes a <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ViewEventArgs> object for the type of action on the design surface, and then passes the object to the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ViewEventHandler> delegate.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ViewEventArgs.Region%2A> property represents the control designer region that the event applies to.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ViewEventArgs.EventType%2A> property of the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ViewEventArgs> object indicates which type of action:
A <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ViewEvent.Click> event.
A <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ViewEvent.Paint> event.
A <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ViewEvent.TemplateModeChanged> event.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ViewEventArgs.EventArgs%2A> property supplies the event arguments that are specific to the type of action.
For example, the designer host initializes <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ViewEventArgs> objects as follows:
A <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerRegionMouseEventArgs> object when you click a region.
A <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PaintEventArgs> object when a control is drawn on the design surface.
A <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.TemplateModeChangedEventArgs> object when the template editing mode changes for the control on the design surface.
For more information about events and delegates, see [NIB: Events and Delegates](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/d98fd58b-fa4f-4598-8378-addf4355a115).
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.Design.ViewEventArgs"></xref> class for the type of view event on the design surface.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ViewEventArgs.%23ctor%2A> constructor is used by the designer host to initialize a <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ViewEventArgs> object for the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.IControlDesignerView.ViewEvent> event.
The designer host passes the initialized <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ViewEventArgs> object to the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ViewEventHandler> delegate.

Typically, `region` is set for <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ViewEvent.Click> events, and `null` (`Nothing` in Visual Basic) for <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ViewEvent.Paint> and <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ViewEvent.TemplateModeChanged> events.
The type of action that raised the event; used to initialize the <xref href="System.Web.UI.Design.ViewEventArgs.EventType"></xref>.
The designer region that the action applies to; used to initialize the <xref href="System.Web.UI.Design.ViewEventArgs.Region"></xref>.
The event arguments associated with eventType; used to initialize the .
Gets the event arguments that are associated with the action that raised the event.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ViewEventArgs.EventArgs%2A> property supplies the event arguments that are specific to the type of action that is specified in the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ViewEventArgs.EventType%2A> property.

For example, when you click a region, the designer host initializes the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ViewEventArgs.EventType%2A> as a <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ViewEvent.Click> event, and then initializes the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ViewEventArgs.EventArgs%2A> property as a <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerRegionMouseEventArgs> object.

Similarly, the designer host initializes the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ViewEventArgs.EventArgs%2A> property with a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PaintEventArgs> object for a <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ViewEvent.Paint> event, or a <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.TemplateModeChangedEventArgs> object for a <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ViewEvent.TemplateModeChanged> event.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ViewEventArgs.EventArgs%2A> property is initialized by the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ViewEventArgs.%23ctor%2A> constructor.
An <xref href="System.Web.UI.Design.ViewEventArgs.EventArgs"></xref> that contains additional event data that is specific to the type of event.
Gets the type of action that raised the event.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ViewEventArgs.EventType%2A> property of the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ViewEventArgs> object indicates which type of action raised the event:
A <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ViewEvent.Click> event.
A <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ViewEvent.Paint> event.
A <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ViewEvent.TemplateModeChanged> event.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ViewEventArgs.EventArgs%2A> property supplies the event arguments that are specific to the type of action.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ViewEventArgs.EventType%2A> property is initialized by the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ViewEventArgs.%23ctor%2A> constructor.
A <xref href="System.Web.UI.Design.ViewEvent"></xref> that specifies the type of action that raised the event.
Gets the designer region that the event applies to.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ViewEventArgs.Region%2A> property represents the control designer region that the event applies to.

Typically, the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ViewEventArgs.Region%2A> property is set for <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ViewEvent.Click> events, and `null` (`Nothing` in Visual Basic) for <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ViewEvent.Paint> and <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ViewEvent.TemplateModeChanged> events.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ViewEventArgs.Region%2A> property is initialized by the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ViewEventArgs.%23ctor%2A> constructor.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerRegion"></xref> that the action applies to.
